meanings.definition: Completing or enhancing something when added to it.
meanings.sent1: The supplemental materials helped me understand the lesson better.
meanings.sent2: I bought a supplemental book to provide more information on the topic.
meanings.sent3: The supplemental video made the class more interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a supplemental ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The colorful illustrations in the supplemental guide made the content easier to grasp.

meanings.sent1: She brought a supplemental snack to share with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The company offered a supplemental bonus for outstanding performance.
meanings.sent3: The supplemental toppings on the pizza made it even more delicious.
meanings.sent4: His jokes were like supplemental bursts of laughter in the room.
meanings.sent5: The supplemental information in the report provided a deeper insight into the issue.
